biography: Frederick George Reinert Jr. (September 14, 1925 â€“ November 5, 2018), known professionally as Rick Reinert,  was an American animator and the founder of the defunct studio Rick Reinert Productions. In addition to his work on two Winnie-the-Pooh projects for Disney during the early 1980s, he directed intros for After School Special and ABC Weekend Special, and was also a producer on Cap'n O. G.
